name: Vegetable Kofta Curry
history: Vegetable Kofta Curry is a vegetarian adaptation of the traditional Kofta Curry. It's a popular dish in Indian cuisine, featuring deep-fried vegetable balls served in a creamy, spiced gravy.
description: Vegetable Kofta Curry consists of mixed vegetable balls, deep-fried until golden and then simmered in a rich, aromatic tomato-based sauce. It's a delightful blend of vegetables, spices, and cream.

equipment.name: pan
equipment.description: For frying koftas and preparing the curry.

instructions.title: Prepare Vegetable Koftas
instructions.description: Mix mashed potatoes, grated carrots, peas, grated paneer, cornflour, garam masala, and salt. Form into balls and deep fry until golden brown. Set aside.

instructions.title: Make the Curry
instructions.description: In a pan, heat oil. SautÃ© onions and ginger-garlic paste until golden. Add tomato puree, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder. Cook until oil separates.

instructions.title: Combine Koftas with Curry
instructions.description: Add the fried koftas to the curry. Add water for desired consistency and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.

instructions.title: Finish with Cream
instructions.description: Stir in cream and simmer for another 5 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.

tips: Make sure the koftas are not too soft before frying to prevent them from breaking apart.
Adjust the amount of chili powder according to your heat preference.
variations: Add cashew paste to the curry for a richer flavor.
For a vegan version, use tofu instead of paneer and coconut cream instead of dairy cream.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl, garnished with a sprinkle of garam masala.
Pair with a fresh green salad for a balanced meal.
